FuncDef:
The rewrite no-action command configures a dot1q Layer 2 sub-interface to transparently transmit received packets, instead of removing VLAN tags from the packets.
The undo rewrite no-action command restores the default configuration. The rewrite no-action command configures a dot1q Layer 2 sub-interface to transparently transmit received packets, instead of removing VLAN tags from the packets. The undo rewrite no-action command restores the default configuration. By default, a dot1q Layer 2 sub-interface removes VLAN tags from received packets, instead of transparently transmitting them. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ParentView: 100GE Layer 2 sub-interface view,200GE Layer 2 sub-interface view,400GE Layer 2 sub-interface view,50GE Layer 2 sub-interface view,Eth-Trunk Layer 2 sub-interface view,Layer 2 sub-interface view
ExtraInfo: When a service access point is configured in the EVC model, if a Layer 2 sub-interface is selected and the encapsulation mode of the Layer 2 sub-interface is Dot1q, the sub-interface removes VLAN tags from received packets by default. To enable a Layer 2 sub-interface to transparently transmit single-tagged data packets, run the rewrite no-action command.
